answers.answer: Yes,  it's very possible. I'm 16wks+4d and so far lost 10 lbs (from thighs and waist). As long as your eating well and Dr isn't concerned your ok. :)

Due to increased metabolism and morning sickness some women will lose in the beginning. Its not that bad when baby is not that big. Im in my 3rd trimester though when the baby needs to grow a lot and I lost about 15 lbs last month so thats not good.  Baby is a little smaller than he should be and I'm on bed rest.

ive lost about 25 altoghter. im 30 weeks tomorrow. i was overweight before and was put n a strict diet because of gestational diabetes. as long as the doctor isnt concerned, your consuming enough calories, and baby is growing well then your all good.  (:
If u figure out how to make ur thighs smaller pregnant or not let me know...

Yes...but I agree with the ladies to make sure you're eating well and check with dr. Im down 15 lbs and in my 2nd trimester (same thing happened with my first pregnancy). My dr said its normal due to increased metabolism & making better choices (no booze & better food).
I am 23 weeks and lost 21 pounds so far. I eat a lot of fruit and fiber and cottage cheese.
I lost weight with my first 2 pregnancies and with this one so far is looking like im losing weight again  I dont get it.

question: Is it possible to actually lose weight in your thighs while pregnant?
title: lose weight while pregnant?
